message_history.content:
Answer the given question. You must conduct reasoning inside <think> and </think> first every time you get new information. After reasoning, if you find you lack some knowledge, you can call a search engine by <search> query </search> and it will return the top searched results between <information> and </information>. You can search as many times as your want. If you find no further external knowledge needed, you can directly provide the answer inside <answer> and </answer>, without detailed illustrations. For example, <answer> Beijing </answer>. Question: Help me to compile a complete list of U.S. Supreme Court justices who were successfully confirmed from President Richard Nixon’s first term through President Joe Biden’s term. For each justice, record:
Name, Position (Chief Justice or Associate Justice), Tenure Start Date(in the format as YYYY-MM-DD), Tenure End Date (enter “NA” for currently serving justices as of the end of 2024), Nominating President, President’s Party Affiliation, Ideological Leaning (Conservative or Liberal), Most Recent Prior Position

Please output the organized data in Markdown table format.
The column names in the table should be, in order:
Name | Position | Tenure Start Date | Tenure End Date | Nominating President | President’s Party | Ideological Leaning | Previous Position

Don't ask me any questions, just output the results according to the columns without omitting cells arbitrarily. The output format is: 
 ```markdown
{data_content}
```.?

<think>
To start, I need to gather information on all Supreme Court justices nominated during Richard Nixon's first term through Joe Biden's term. This includes their position, tenure dates, nominating president, president's party affiliation, ideological leaning, and most recent prior position.

I'll begin by searching for the relevant information.
</think>

<search>Supreme Court justices nominated from Richard Nixon's first term through Joe Biden's term</search>

Search query: Supreme Court justices nominated from Richard Nixon's first term through Joe Biden's term
Result: [Doc 1](https://www.senate.gov/legislative/nominations/SupremeCourtNominations1789present.htm):
Supreme Court Nominations (1789-Present) - Senate.gov Supreme Court Nominations (1789-Present) ; O'Connor, Sandra Day, Stewart ; President Ford, Gerald ; Stevens, John Paul, Douglas ; President Nixon, Richard.

[Doc 2](https://www.supremecourt.gov/about/members_text.aspx):
Justices 1789 to Present - Supreme Court Justices 1789 to Present ; Blackmun, Harry A. · Minnesota, Nixon, June 9, 1970 ; Powell, Lewis F., Jr. Virginia, Nixon, January 7, 1972 ...

[Doc 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_nominations_to_the_Supreme_Court_of_the_United_States):
List of nominations to the Supreme Court of the United States Since 1789, there have been 165 formal nominations (of 146 persons) to the Supreme Court; 128 of them (123 persons) have been confirmed.

I need to compile this data systematically. Let's start by gathering the names, positions, and dates of confirmation.
</think>

<search>Nixon Supreme Court Justices</search>

Search query: Nixon Supreme Court Justices
Result: [Doc 1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Nixon_Supreme_Court_candidates):
Richard Nixon Supreme Court candidates - Wikipedia Martha W. Griffiths (1912–2003) – Michigan · Margaret M. Heckler (1931–2018) – Massachusetts · Wilbur Mills (1909–1992) – Arkansas · Richard H. Poff (1923–2011) – ...

[Doc 2](https://www.nixonlibrary.gov/news/nixon-and-supreme-court):
Nixon and the Supreme Court | Richard Nixon Museum and Library Richard Nixon nominated six justices to the Supreme Court (four of which were confirmed by the Senate) during his presidency. The confirmation ...

[Doc 3](https://ir.law.fsu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?referer=&httpsredir=1&article=1787&context=lr):
[PDF] Nixon's Legacy to the Supreme Court - Scholarship Repository With the appoint- ment of William Rehnquist and Lewis Powell to the Supreme Court in 1971, President Nixon had made four appointments to the Court in the ...

Based on the information, Nixon nominated six justices but only four were confirmed:

1. William Rehnquist (1971)
2. Lewis F. Powell, Jr. (1972)
3. Harry A. Blackmun (1970)
4. John Paul Stevens (1975)

Lewis F. Powell Jr. Lewis Franklin Powell Jr. (September 19, 1907 – August 25, 1998) was an American lawyer and jurist who served as an associate justice of the Supreme Court

Lewis F. Powell, Jr. In 1971, Nixon needed to fill Hugo Black's position on the Supreme Court. On January 6, 1972, Powell was sworn in as an Associate Justice to the Supreme Court.
